articles.title: SpaceX wants to put 1 million solar-powered data centers into orbit
articles.description: SpaceX filed a request with the FCC on Friday seeking approval to put a constellation of 1 million data center satellites into orbit. While the FCC is unlikely to approve a network that expansive, SpaceX's strategy has been to request approval for unrealistically large numbers of satellites as a sta
articles.content: SpaceX filed a request with the FCC on Friday seeking approval to put a constellation of 1 million data center satellites into orbit. While the FCC is unlikely to approve a network that expansive, SpaceX's strategy has been to request approval for unrealistically large numbers of satellites as a starting point for negotiations. The filing proposes establishing a network of solar-powered data centers in low Earth orbit that communicate with one another via lasers. The filling speaks of the conste

articles.content: Elon Musk and his aerospace company have requested to build a network that's 100 times the number of satellites that are currently in orbit. On Friday, SpaceX filed an application with the Federal Communications Commission (FCC) to launch a million satellites meant to create an "orbital data center." articles.content: For the last couple of years, I‚Äôve been following the progress of a group of individuals who believe death is humanity‚Äôs ‚Äúcore problem.‚Äù Put simply, they say death is wrong‚Äîfor everyone. articles.description: A lip-syncing robot, Leonardo's DNA, and new evidence that humans, not glaciers, moved stones to Stonehenge
articles.content: It‚Äôs a regrettable reality that there is never enough time to cover all the interesting scientific stories we come across each month. So every month, we highlight a handful of the best stories that nearly slipped through the cracks. January‚Äôs list includes a lip-syncing robot; using brewer's yeast as scaffolding for lab-grown meat; hunting for Leonardo da Vinci's DNA in his art; and new evidence that humans really did transport the stones to build Stonehenge from Wales and northern Scotland, rat

articles.title: The Cult of Clean Code
articles.description: A few days ago, I watched a senior developer spend 3 days refactoring a perfectly functional feature because the functions were "too long." The code worked. Users were happy. Tests were green. But somewhere, Robert C. Martin's ghost was apparently crying, so we had to fix it. Spoiler alert: the refa
articles.content: A few days ago, I watched a senior developer spend 3 days refactoring a perfectly functional feature because the functions were "too long." The code worked. Users were happy. Tests were green. But somewhere, Robert C. Martin's ghost was apparently crying, so we had to fix it. Spoiler alert: the refactored version introduced two bugs and made the codebase harder to understand. But hey, at least the functions were under 10 lines each, right? The Clean Code Kool Aid I get it. When you're drowning i

To address that gap, Ayaneo launched a premium option with the Pocket S Mini . As a "true 4:3 retro handheld," the Pocket S Mini won
articles.content: There may be plenty of gaming handhelds out there, but there aren't many horizontal options that let you play childhood favorites in the original 4:3 aspect ratio. To address that gap, Ayaneo launched a premium option with the Pocket S Mini . As a "true 4:3 retro handheld," the Pocket S Mini won't have those pesky vertical black bars whenever you're emulating video games from the CRT television era. Handhelds like the Anbernic RG405M and even Ayaneo's own Pocket Air Mini already
articles.author: Jackson Chen

All of them were carrying signs and wearing whistles around their necks on top of layers and layers of winter clothing. At first there were dozens of us […]
articles.content: It was too cold to take off my mittens and check Google Maps so I put my faith in the trickle of bundled-up people ahead of me. All of them were carrying signs and wearing whistles around their necks on top of layers and layers of winter clothing. At first there were dozens of us walking toward Government Plaza, across the street from Minneapolis City Hall, and within a block it was hundreds. By the time I arrived it was thousands. Some reports said five to ten thousand, but on the ground, it fe
articles.author: Gaby Del Valle

articles.content: OnlyFans is looking to cash out once again, but this time in a deal that would value it at several billion dollars less than a potential sale that previously fell through. As reported by TechCrunch , the online platform known for subscription-based pornographic content is in talks to sell a majority stake to Architect Capital, an investment firm based in San Francisco. articles.title: A cup of coffee for depression treatment has better results than microdosing
articles.description: The effect of microdosing have been overstated, at least when it comes to depression.
articles.content: About a decade ago, many media outlets‚Äîincluding WIRED ‚Äîzeroed in on a weird trend at the intersection of mental health, drug science, and Silicon Valley biohacking: microdosing , or the practice of taking a small amount of a psychedelic drug seeking not full-blown hallucinatory revels but gentler, more stable effects. Typically using psilocybin mushrooms or LSD, the archetypal microdoser sought less melting walls and open-eye kaleidoscopic visuals than boosts in mood and energy, like a gentle s
articles.author: John Semley, wired.com

articles.title: The TV industry finally concedes that the future may not be in 8K
articles.description: With virtually no content and limited benefits, 8K TVs were doomed.
articles.content: Technology companies spent part of the 2010s trying to convince us that we would want an 8K display one day. In 2012, Sharp brought the first 8K TV prototype to the CES trade show in Las Vegas. In 2015, the first 8K TVs started selling in Japan for 16 million yen (about $133,034 at the time), and in 2018, Samsung released the first 8K TVs in the US , starting at a more reasonable $3,500. By 2016, the Video Electronics Standards Association (VESA) had a specification for supporting 8K (Display Po
articles.author: Scharon Harding

articles.title: ICE protester says her Global Entry was revoked after agent scanned her face
articles.description: Global Entry and Precheck revoked three days after incident, court filing says.
articles.content: Minnesota resident Nicole Cleland had her Global Entry and TSA Precheck privileges revoked three days after an incident in which she observed activity by immigration agents, the woman said in a court declaration. An agent told Cleland that he used facial recognition technology to identify her, she wrote in a declaration filed in US District Court for the District of Minnesota. Cleland, a 56-year-old resident of Richfield and a director at Target Corporation, volunteers with a group that tracks p
articles.author: Jon Brodkin
